Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again, but a new kind of adventure for us”
Reviews.Author: rhonda60103
Reviews.Content: we were cruising on Sunday, so we came in Saturday night and this was the best we could find near the ports. We arrived in the rain, and there were some local characters sitting outside, rather unwilling to move. We nearly had to carry our suitcases in to avoid hitting them. Once in, we were changed from 2nd floor to 3rd due to a water problem - and the gentleman who checked us in offered to carry our luggage up. He managed our two 50# suitcases with no apparent problem. The room is t-i-n-y. Cute. The seating area is very attractive but uncomfortable. The bed was fine, the bathroom was tiny but fine. It rained all night, and it sounded like the rain was directly into our room. No leaks, just an unusual architecture. We wandered around in the morning, found our cruise ship, as well as a Starbucks. They held our luggage while we shopped. It was probably 80 degrees and humid when we hauled our suitcases the 6 blocks to the cruise ship. Sure, we could've taken a cab, but it was part of the adventure. Overall, it was ok. I wanted to stay at the Sheraton (or any chain I am familiar with), but it was spring break week and most hotels were unavailable even 6 months in advance. I was getting nervous when I booked the CasaBlanca. It was acceptable - safe, clean, weird, attractive. Not my usual, but maybe I'll be more adventurous from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: JimBGrandRapids_MI
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Saturday, April 7. I requested 2nd floor, thanks to previous reviews, and also knew to expect a noisy late night crowd. We got little sleep, but knew to expect that in advance. The hotel is in the middle of a vibrant, rocking scene. Know it and deal with it. I did not expect to have a nightstand light with a broken switch, NO hot water at all, a shower faucet handle that fell off in my hands, and no cups or glasses or kleenex in the room. Cute hotel, but they need to pay more attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cozy and well located”
Reviews.Author: asnaka
Reviews.Content: The decor of the hotel is incredible, l found it very cozy, quiet and amazing location. It has free wireless at the lobby, breakfast included (cereal, toast, juice, coffee), the room l got was small but very cute. The only bad thing l could say it didn't have elevator, but other than that the staff was friendly and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pack Light In Case You Need to Run!”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: When you hear â€œCasablancaâ€� you canâ€™t help think of the 1942 romantic drama starting Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman set in the Moroccan city of the same name. Iâ€™m a native Puerto Rican. I visit once or twice every year and I have seen Old San Juan being revitalized throughout the years. I do feel nostalgic walking on the blue cobblestones streets that adorn our old city and I have fond memories as a child walking on these streets with my mother eating plantain chips and coconut helados or gelato. Many a times on my visits, I passed by the Casablanca Hotel in Old San Juan and never peaked in. Last year, I couldnâ€™t help myself. Looking for an oasis in the midst of a hot day with a heavy traffic of cars and tourists, I walked into the hotel lobby. To my surprise, the hotel did not had a film noir qualities of shadows and soft lighting, instead it was rich in color and textures. Beautifully decorated with restored antiques and art from one of the owners according to the receptionist. Me and my best friend from Orlando booked rooms at Casablanca this year. When we arrived, the lobby was as beautiful as I remembered. There was different art on the walls, but the art was just as stunning and colorful. Then wham! Two of our reservations didnâ€™t show in their systems. The staff was rude, defensive, and condescending. When we asked for the manager to assist us, the girl at the desk said he was out. After I got frustrated and raised my tone of voice due to her lack of empathy, he mysteriously appeared from behind a curtain like a genie, but a condescending and rude one. Pedro was his name. Pedro needs to be trained in customer service as his skills and attitude suck. There isnâ€™t an elevator in this hotel; so pack light. No one offer us help to carry our luggage. So, if you need some type of assistance, you may want to book the Sheraton Old San Juan, which is nearby. My friendâ€™s room was cute, but small. The shower didnâ€™t have a place for toiletries; we put them on the floor. â€“ I hate to pick up soap from the floor. The bed was comfortable. There wasnâ€™t room to put luggage and there wasnâ€™t closet or armoire. My reservation was never found so I booked a different hotel. See my upcoming review of Water Club, Isla Verde. The Casablanca was a catastrophic mirage. My friend told me that two days later they moved him to a nicer room, but they didnâ€™t make his bed one day because â€œthere is only one key to the room and he took it.â€� WHAT? Have you EVER heard such a lie? He also said he overheard some people complaining in the lobby about having their jewelry being stolen from their room. Even though I had a bad experience with this hotel, I am NOT spiteful. HOWEVER, I urge you to think twice before you book this hotel. Again, the hotel is cute, and so are the rooms. I would NEVER go back to Casablanca unless I know that they have new management and that Pedro is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Daniela R
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our one night in Old San Juan and the location was perfect. The lobby is large, interesting and inviting and the front desk staff was friendly. As others mentioned, there is no elevator and that's a big pain when you're on the top floor as we were. You don't get much help with your bags. We knew this when we made the reservation so we packed two smaller bags, instead of one big one, but it was tough all the same. Our room was plain but clean and acceptable, although it lacked enough blankets for how cold the AC gets. Only having WiFi in the lobby was a drawback but not insurmountable. The best thing is that we were able to leave our bags at the hotel while we did sightseeing after checkout. Overall, a good value for the location but with its drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful evening in Old San juan”
Reviews.Author: gladwewerethere
Reviews.Content: This is an old, European style hotel. There is no elevator and service is slow. The front desk staff was slow but helpful after a long wait. The restaurant staff seemed to be doing us a favor by feeding us. The room was very small and very old but clean. The location was worth all of the preceding inadequacies.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Phil P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay of 2 days/nights in Old San Juan and Hotel Casablanca - such a different, colorful and vibrant place. The location of the hotel is great - can walk to all the attractions of Old San Juan - no need for a car. Our room (2B) was big (a separate bedroom, bathroom and lounge room) and just what I hoped for in Old San Juan - great furnishings with character - we really felt like we were in Puerto Rico which we were. OK, you have to carry you suitcases up and down the stairs (no lift) but you only have to do this once, so as long as you are reasonably fit you will manage. Noise, yep there is street noise but for us that was not a problem (maybe if you are a light sleeper you will have a problem). Breakfast was simple but nice. I am glad we stayed at Hotel Casablanca in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't wait to write this review!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfivefamily
Reviews.Content: After enduring a stay here this past weekend, I spent my time in the hotel room taking notes on what I was going to write because I was so irritated and I hope to spare any future guests the pain of staying here. Where do I begin? First of all, trying to lug heavy suitcases up those stairs just about did me in. There was only one guy (he was nice) at the desk and nobody to help carry the luggage up, it was a nightmare. We had asked for adjacent rooms and got rooms that were on different floors, which was unacceptable with us having 3 kids. They would not let us cancel the reservation without a penalty, so I decided to just suck it up and deal with it. But staying in a hotel should not feel like a prison sentence. My first look at our 3rd floor room reminded me of prison. It was small, dark, with a tiny window and hard floors and tiny bathroom. I felt claustrophobic in it. The 2nd room with a kind sized bed was bigger, but the views out of the window were horrible. I am going to try to attach a photo so you can see it. Pros: (I tried really hard to think of good things to say) The building was sturdy and the walls were thick. The sink bowl was pretty. The lobby had interesting decor. That about sums up the good stuff. Cons: No towel rack or counter space in the tiny bathroom. No shampoo, conditioner, lotion or kleenex. The towels were flimsy and too few (we got 4 small towels for a family of 5) and no hand towels, no washcloths, etc. As I mentioned before, NO ELEVATOR! If you have a lot of heavy luggage and a 5th floor room, this will kill you, destroy your back, give you tennis elbow, put you in a bad mood, etc. The 4th floor room we were in had small windows with ugly black curtains, which makes no sense in an already dark room. I went to the window to look out and realized why the curtains were black. They were intended to block the hideous view of industrial waste. I took some photos of it. Our rooms were freezing cold, and the only way to reach the temp control was to stand on top of the tv table and risk breaking your neck. The other option would have been to rent a ladder. Hiking down all of those stairs to bother the one guy working there did not seem like something I felt like doing. The floors were not carpeted, seemed like concrete. If you took a shower (the shower handle fell off when we tried to use it) then you would inevitably track water all over the concrete floor because there was nothing to absorb the water. If you wear contact lenses, or want to brush your teeth, or put on makeup, etc, you will not be able to do it in the bathroom because there is no counter. Just a sink. I went to bed early for the sole purpose of trying to make the next day come faster so I could check out and get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “So you think you have a reservation.”
Reviews.Author: gc914
Reviews.Content: . The last thing you need after a long day of travel is to have no reservation. We prepaid this room through Hotels well in advance. We got an email from Hotels a few days before our departure confirming our reservation with the hotel. This means nothing. We were not the only people in this situation when we got there. Another group booked with Bookings and they had no record of their reservations as well. At least they got to choose an alternative room at a higher price. We were told there was only one tiny, windowless, hole of a room left. We had no choice. The lobby of this hotel is adorable. You are not staying in the lobby. No towels, no cups, no wastebasket. Only enough room for a bed. Could not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KanawhaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a booked a room at the CasaBlanca for March 2, 2012. I was excited to see the hotel after seeing the photos. We booked 2 rooms, each with a balcony (that we thought was over the street). Yes, the lobby is very neat and trendy. Loved that. Our rooms were on the 5th floor. That is too far to carry heavy luggage upstairs (but we were aware of no elevators so we can take the fault for that). We had booked 2 rooms with a walk out balcony that was supposed to be over the street- or felt that was insinuated. Upon getting to our room, our friends had a room that had a window that opened to a hallway that had a balcony on it. Our room had no balcony at all. After complaining, I was told that there are different types of balconies. We did get a refund for the cost of a balcony room to a reg. room. Our friends did not. So be ware if you book a balcony room. You may be surprised. The lobby was very clean and nice, the rooms were very small. No wastebasket in the room or bathroom. Bathroom was not real nice. Our room was o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking seems to be common”
Reviews.Author: millerman
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel months ago for a one night stay before joining a cruise ship. Due to a flight delay we didn't arrive till 2330 but my son phoned from the UK to inform them. On arrival at the hotel we were told they were overbooked and we would be transferred to another hotel - which turned out to be miles from any where and a $20 taxi ride from the old town where we wanted to be. The night manager arranged everything, but after sitting in the lobby for 1.5 hours I asked what the delay was only to be told we couldn't check in at the new hotel until 0300! By this time we had been travelling for 20 hours and my patience was wearing thin. Even after insisting we were moved straight away, it still took another hour to get all the details sorted and a taxi ordered. Looking back at the recent comments it seems this is a common occurance. I would not trust this hotel or its management or recommend anyone book here. After hours of travelling the last thing you need is a transfer to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Use caution”
Reviews.Author: albert c
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby is very pop art, that's as far as it goes. The clerk didn't seem to be interested in wheather we stayed or not. 5th floor, no elevator and no offer of assistance( couldn't leave desk). The room although accectably clean was very small. No idea what the bed was,hard,uncomfortable and if you moved it made a terrible noise. The continental breakfast was a choice of a slice of toast or cheerios and undrinkable coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Beware...”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room at Hotel Casablanca for the last night of our honeymoon. The afternoon of our reservation, I received a call from the hotel saying that they had plumbing issues, and that we were moved to another one of their properties, Pop Art. When we arrived at Pop Art, we were shown to a room that slept eight, with bunk beds. Also, there was no hot water. It was a disappointing last night of our honeymoon. The photos of the Hotel Casablanca look lovely, but after our experience, I would not risk making a reservation there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE THEY DO NOT HONOR RESERVATIONS”
Reviews.Author: Jesus-Freak316
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 6 months prior for one night. We arrived and were told that the hotel was overbooked and we were going to be moved to one of thier other hotels that were far away from old san juan and bad area, one she tried to send us to was even a Hostil. We told her that this was not acceptable, so after a while of calling around she got us into the howard Johnsons in old San Juan, we had a decent room there, not great, but at least a warm bed, and a hot shower. We were one of Many many customers standing in the lobby that night with no room but guarteed reservations and they had no rooms. They also have no elevator so if you stay here be prepared to carry your luggage up 3 plus flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY! Overbooked and moved to a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: csebec
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 6 months prior for 1 night before flying out the next day. We arrived and were told that the hotel was overbooked and we were going to be moved to their sister hotel "Pop Art". She then told us that we had not paid yet so would have to pay. We HAD paid- our cards were charged in December! After arguing with her she suddenly found that we had paid. So after we protested more about being bumped out, we were told it was a comparable hotel in a nice area near good restaurants. We were told that we would be shown multiple rooms and could pick the one we wanted. They agreed to pay our taxi to the new hotel and when the taxi came he had no idea where it was, hint #1 Pop Art was not great. After driving around for awhile and many calls from the driver we pull up to a gated door with no name outside and the receptionist waving us down! We go in to find what is best described as a Youth Hostel. The receptionist then informs us that they only have 1 room available and it sleeps 8 and shares a bathroom! Mind you we paid $125 to stay at Casablanca and now are being told that we have to share a room and bathroom! We proceed to tell her that we are not staying here. There were multiple groups of teens and 20 somethings coming in and out and another couple who were also bumped from Casablanca and they were not happy either. Our husbands asked to use the restroom and she takes a key for what is the room that we would be staying him and leads them to that bathroom. There is no public restroom. The room had 2 sets of twin bunk beds and a set of queen bunk beds and 1 bathroom. The beds had not blankets, just a bottom sheet. No TV, decorations, no night stands, lamps, nothing! the neighborhood was way off the beaten path, which in San Juan is shady. There were no restaurants nearby. I felt bad for the receptionist as it was not her fault. She called Casablanca and they told her it was a mix up and they would make arrangements for us to stay elsewhere. So we waited for over an hour for this to happen and were told it would be the Howard Johnsons which is an even bigger dump. We told the receptionist to call her back at Casablanca and get a different place and that is when she stopped answering the phone. We then started looking for other places ourselves. We told the Pop Art lady to call Casablanca and tell them to refund our money and we would find our own place to stay. Still no answer. We made reservations at Holiday Inn Express and the Pop Art agreed to pay our taxi to the new hotel-which she did not have to do. She promised she would get our refund, we don't have high hopes and I have sent Casablanca an email demanding our money back. We shall see..... Holiday Inn Express was clean and no complaints but not in Old San Juan like we wanted. Do not stay here and if you do beware of booking and paying early!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I've Read Is True...Both Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: chumley1217
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a single pre-cruise night knowing from other reviews that it wasn't perfect. My priorities are, in order: cleanliness, location, price and amenities, like free breakfast. It was clean, the location is fantastic in old San Juan, the price was excellent, and it had a very modest table-service continental breakfast included. But, echoing what others have said in earlier reviews, here's stuff you need to know before you choose this place over pricier ones in the old town area, or go with something along the Condado beach row. This hotel is 5 stories tall and there are no elevators, so you might have a long climb. Worse, there's no one assigned to help with your bags, making the climb to your room quite a workout, especially around the narrow, winding staircase. The people in front of us insisted that someone help them with baggage and, after a delay, a guy in scruffy jeans showed up, but clearly it's not a service they provide. That surprised me because I read so many comments giving them low ratings partly because of this fact, coupled with there being no elevator. Obviously, they can't do much about an elevator, but they certainly would boost comments if they offered baggage service. Another downside is noise, varying greatly depending on bar activity. We were there Saturday night, and it was LOUD. One side of the building that apparently had been open, has been enclosed with several stories of large glass panels, creating an atrium. The sounds of partying echo very loudly upward. The majority of rooms seem to surround the atrium, and I've read that rooms facing the street can encounter lots of late night street noise. We anticipated this negative, brought earplugs, and slept well, but others have rated it unacceptable for noise reasons. We had no problems with the hot water, as some others have, but we didn't place a lot of demand on it. The employees were fine, neither solicitous nor surly. Finally, they don't seem well organized. While we were checking in, one of the couples that had checked in ahead of us came back to complain that the room hadn't been made up. In our case, they had our reservation, but tried to charge me for the night, though I had pre-paid it last September. I knew the date and amount of my payment, and they quickly admitted their error, but it conveys sloppy management. In fact, they operate from a laptop as they sit at a table, with reservation printouts next to them, and disappear behind a curtain a couple of times with each reservation. Comes across as amateurish and drawn out. If you're using this hotel for a pre-cruise stay, make sure what pier your ship uses. We had thought it was Old San Juan piers, just a few blocks walk from the hotel, but our ship used the Pan American Pier, a $15-$20 taxi ride away. Bottom line is if you can live with the downsides for a short stay, the location is wonderful, the price is very reasonable, it's clean, and you're in a centuries-old building with lots of character and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and nice decor but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Spacebabe77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after our cruise. Our friends picked the place so didnt check the reviews on the place before staying here. Staff were fairly helpful and the place was very clean and tidy. The decor is a very nice decor. For the price we paid in that area its not bad. Friends of ours stayed at a place a couple blocks away for double the price and it was definitely nicer. No elevators. Thankfully we had the second floor so not much stairs to climb. Friends of ours had the fifth floor and they had 4 pieces of luggage, so it is a lot to carry up. Our room had no window, just one frosted ceiling window above the shower stall which was separate from the bathroom that held the toilet and sink. They have the bare minimum... 3 small soap bars. No shampoo and conditioner nor hair dryer so ladies if you need these items bring them with you! Also the floors are all completely hard stone floors so bring slippers! My only BIG complaint is the noise. Basically our room on the second floor was across from the balcony that opens up into the lobby... so we can hear any talking in the lobby. In the morning around 8am.. we could hear a lto of banging from somewhere as well non stop right up to when we were checking out at 11am. I noticed down the hall way men working on the hotel. They had a pylon to show that it was a working area and i could hear TONS of construction noises all morning. It was a bit frustrating. Also you can hear the morning breakfast noises as well. Also we were one room over from the stairs. Anyone going up and down the stairs in flip flops made for a lot of slapping noise room. I noticed someone commented about hearing the noises in their room and they were right. It felt like a lto of the noises was IN our room. The noise really travels through the hotel and right into the walls. Friends of ours that stayed on the top level which was the roof.. said it was noisy as well. They could hear the fan motor of the AC (perhaps) on the roof running. I also noticed that when we checked in I over heard a gentleman who was staying there say that he couldnt sleep all night as there was a party going on in the lobby that carried over into his room. In the morning the lady at the front desk was SUPER nice and helpful on all fronts. So all in all its a great hotel for what you pay for and it was only for one night, but I probably wont be going back as I prefer to be able to SLEEP in a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “words fail”
Reviews.Author: Layla777
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say that we had a terrible stay here. The hotel failed to provide semi decent beds or bedding, the staff (especially Noella and other front desk personnel) were very rude and literally rolled their eyes when asked for help, for example, with luggage. We have stay many places and these employees are extraordinarily unprofessional and discourteous. In fact, we have stayed in $2 a night hotels in Asia with better service and conditions. To top it off, the hotel hosts incredibly loud parties that include karaoke in their lobby, creating deafening noise in the rooms until about 1 am. We were exhausted from our stay and so glad to leave. One bellman named Steve was very good and courteous, I recommend to him that he finds a job at a better hotel for his own sake.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stay”
Reviews.Author: cschuten
Reviews.Content: We wanted a feel for historic old San Juan. This is it. Pros and Cons...but great place for a short stay. Pros....Right in the middle of everything, Great Resturaunts and shopping. Funky hotel with an eclectic Morocan-ish decor. GREAT lobby bar with yummy mohitos. Cons...As you have heard, no elevator. We are 30somethings and whew..carrying your luggage. Tough. If you are an older person or not in semi-decent shape I cant reccomend this place. Very limited selection of tv stations...but your not here to watch TV right? LOUD music coming from the lobby bar..but I say hey, JOIN THE PARTY! Good for a short stay. We did a one night before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: SeeGodsWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise out of San Juan. Our room was on third floor , no elevators or staff to assist with getting your luggage up 3 flights of stairs. No closet or drawers in the room. We had a bed and bath with a 13" tv. Floors are concrete with no rugs . Clean. had to ask for a blow dryer . no water glasses ,Kleenex just the bare essentials .

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Rickyexpress
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is splendid and located in the center of Old San Juan...because it is located so conveniently, I find that some of the services one might expect to hope for are unfortunately dropped at the waist... I DID enjoy my stay at this hotel, as it had good basics...the bed was comfortable, fresh towels were left daily, there was hot water for the shower... So I cannot say this was a "bad" experience.....but as far as getting what you pay for....That might be a whole different story....A friend and I took a last minute weekend excursion down to Puerto Rico for a weekend. We had booked a room that was supposed to have a terrace, and and extra bed.....we did NOT get this room with a terrace, nor did we get the extra bed...which was fine as the one bed we did have was more than large enough to fit both of us, and we had no qualms about sleeping next to each other...But we DID pay for these features, so it would have been nice for us to have been compensated in some way...The staff was very friendly, so there was definitely not a problem with that.. The hotel does offer brunch of some sort, but I did not eat there at all so perhaps a different review might have something to say on that matter... One night, we had a small termite community wander in thru the window...but like most termites...they tend to venture out the same way they came in...so that fortunately was not such a disastor, but it easily could have been... All in all, the hotel is conveniently located in the center of old San Juan, right in the mix of everything.....if you want beach, you must have a car, or take a taxi out of old San Juan to the neighboring town of Isla Verde...about 10 dollars and approximately 5 miles away...definitely not the end of the world....So a good hotel, just not great, and a bit overpriced for what it is...I would entertain staying there again...but would most likely try to find something different... *Also on a side note, make sure to visit El Yunque National Park and go visit the waterfalls...this was a highlight for me...it can be magical if you go SUPER early in the morning...get there around 7 or 8am and you will have the waterfall and much of the rainforest to yourself...go closer to 10 or 11am, and the tour buses will have dropped off about 100 people...thus cheapening the experience.. Hope this is informative for someone out there..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KristaTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: A very nice, small hotel in the centre of Old San Juan. Nice, clean rooms, friendly staff and OK breakfast. The location is great, just down town Old San Juan near all the nice restaurants, club and sights to visit. The only down part was the cold water in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a great place, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jamilas
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location - right in the heart of Old San Juan near everything. The decoration both in the lobby and in the rooms is unique and in keeping with the boutique feel. However, the positive aspects end there. There is no elevator - our room was on the 5th floor and we had to carry all of our own luggage upstairs, there were no blinds or shutters in our room so the hallway lights made it look like daylight in our room at night making it hard to sleep, the showers don't stay one temperature (they went scalding hot to cold every 30 seconds), the bathroom tile was broken and looked like the remodeling hadn't been finished, there were no hangers or closet space or an area to put any clothing, there was a bar of soap but no other toiletries, there were construction materials behind the couch and sticking into the walkway in the seating area outside our room, and they were under-staffed. The list of small shortcomings continues from there. Bottom line: it's not worth the price you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lobby”
Reviews.Author: moopr
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, friendly staff, great location steps from amazing restuarants -esp Marmalade across the street. Great coffee in am, however noisy room -street noise woke me up at 2:30 am. Concrete floors in room were a bit depressing. No soap holder in shower, and a shelf on the wall in the bathroom for your toiletries is def needed. Didn't mind not having an elevator - part of the charm of a boutique hotel. T

Reviews.Title: “LOUDEST hotel with the worst staff.”
Reviews.Author: boaboa30
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at this hotel blasts music all night long with no regard to the fact that they work at a hotel where people presumably sleep at night. They do not turn the music down, even if you ask them to because your one year old is trying to fall asleep. Also, one of the workers invited all of his friends over on Saturday night to party with him in the lobby. We didn't get towels today, eventhough they took our used towels away. All in all, this is a very poorly run hotel with badly trained staff. Don't let the glistening lobby fool you. This is a truly awful hotel. I've had better experiences sleeping in chain motels.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: AVOID AT ALL COSTS Pluses: Great location in old San Juan, well maintained for the most part - rooms are clean and seem well kept. Cons: -The LOUDEST hotel I've ever "slept" in - and it's not from the street or neighboring bars/clubs. There is a large open atrium that goes all the way up which the majority of the rooms face. The staff think nothing of blaring dance music in the lobby until midnight which could be heard quite clearly in our room. My pregnant wife went to the lobby at 8pm with our 18 month old daughter and commented that the music was really loud - the staff responded "I know" and didn't change the volume. I had to ask that the music be turned down every single night. -Rooms are small and missing on details. The floors are concrete and there's not a rug in the place. There were no soap holders in the shower. They seem to have missed the details. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: kdm B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline in November. When we arrived at Hotel Casablanca, in January we were told that they did not have our reservation and they were having plumbing problems in 6 rooms so did not have a room for us. The clerk told us that an affiliated hotel around the corner had a room. He agreed to help us get there with our luggage. He proceeded to lead us up an alley that was crowded with people drinking and partying outside a nightclub. He guided us into D'House hotel which was located directly across from this nightclub. It was obvious in the lobby it was not of the same quality. He told us that the owner would give us a room in the back of the hotel so we would not be disturbed by the noise. He quickly left saying he couldn't do anything more for us and if we wanted to complain we could talk to the manager in the morning. We were then told that we had the last room which was directly over the nightclub and felt like you were in the center of the dance floor. I called Priceline to try to get a relocation but after over an hour on the phone gave up as it was midnight. We were awake until 5am when the noise finally subsided. The rep from Priceline said they would talk to the management because in the event that a hotel overbooks, the expectation by Priceline is that they find alternative accommodation at the same star rating. Casablanca is rated as a 3 star by Priceline, the D'House Hotel-had not been rated by their system-so below a 1 star. In fact they did not even deal with them. D'House was rundown and dirty, the air conditioning did not work properly and the noise level was unbearable. I would never book with Hotel Casablanca because they do not honor your reservations appropriately. I have also suggested to Priceline that this hotel be take off of their website as they had confirmed with Priceline they had received our booking yet told us they did not have our booking. They also do not follow the Priceline's rules about overbooking.

Reviews.Title: “Casablanca that could have been”
Reviews.Author: Fcnomad
Reviews.Content: First the good: located in the center of the old town its a good spot to tour day and night life of old San Juan as well as a place to jump onto a cruise etc. The hotel has an inviting clean new looking lobby With some north african flair. Now the not so good: minimally staffed, any requests are slow to fill. Towels, shampoo etc are often missing in the rooms... Oh, did I mention its a 5 floor walk up with high ceiling floors? A deal breaker for me is that you can hear every noise outside the room from anywhere in the hotel day or night. Lastly, the rooms are sparse with no windows. Mine was clean and freshly painted however. It looks nice from the lobby but this hotel just ends up being a pretty wrapping with a bad surprise inside. Very expensive for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay again”
Reviews.Author: cb_m2012
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading some of the reviews and as a stop over for a couple of days on our way to the BVI. We wanted to stay in old town and spend a day visiting all the historic sites and areas surrounding the hotel. The reception staff upon check in were nice and friendly, however we had pre-picked our rooms at the time of booking, and they did not give us the rooms we had pre-booked.There were two couples traveling and neither of us got the rooms originally selected when we booked in October of 2011. We were first given a room with no windows and upon going back to reception they moved us to a "suite" which had a lovely old world charm overlooking the street. However that evening we discovered there was no hot water in the suite. We made several requests to the front desk staff and were told they were looking into it. At midnight the clerk let us know that he " is not a plumber and cant fix it" so he gave us a key for a vacant room down the hall and told us to shower in there for the night. We did. Next morning we again mentioned it to the front desk and he said the plumber was looking into it today. We were out of the hotel all day sight seeing and upon return were told by different desk staff that it had been fixed, yet we found that there was still no hot water. Upon checking with the front desk they advised us that they had done all they can do. When questioned as to how we were to have a shower with no hot ( or even warm water) they stated they didn't know and that they did not have a room we could use to shower in as the hotel was full, and there was nothing more to be done. This was after several inquiries and being told they were working on it. At this point the "nice" front desk staff became rude and dismissive to us. When pushed to solve the issue they finally gave us a key to a suite 4 floors above, that the guests had not checked in yet, and told to hurry up and have a shower and return the key so that the new guests could check in. The next morning upon checking out the front desk tried to re-charge us for our hotel stay (despite being paid in full on check in) as they had no record of payment made. I produced the credit card slip as proof of payment and they photo-copied it. I was told that they were going to give us a discount due to the inconvenience if no hot water and all the hassles, and that they would call that day to advise us once the manager arrived. We left the hotel with our other guests to head off on our trip to the BVI. It has now been 2 weeks and there has been no call, no discount, no contact and they have charged the full price of the room to the card. I can accept some of the inconveniences that occurred but not the lack of follow up and or serious commitment to customer service when working in the hospitality industry. During my time there it became evident that there are comparable hotels in the same areas as this one that appeared to have better reviews on trip advisor. I advised the desk staff upon check out that I would be writing this review and that it would not be favorable and their response was, whatever, there is nothing they can do.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Namyr
Reviews.Content: I was there for the Sanse12 and the location was perfect . The room was beautiful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and the Ocean Breeze”
Reviews.Author: Alyson_Kate
Reviews.Content: Hotel CasaBlanca is a phenomenal home base for anyone looking to explore the surrounding city and meet fascinating locals. Tucked onto a busy thoroughfare and cooled by ocean breezes from not a 1/4 mile away, this boutique hotel is central to delicious dining, unique shops and historic attractions. Artfully gilt in vintage crystal and original works of art, the lobby is a must-visit. Doubling as an urban lounge, it's equipped with cushy seating, a fully-stocked bar and plenty of good conversation. As a solo traveler who tries to avoid tourist traps, I highly recommend this locale, particularly for its safety and friendliness. The staff is oh so charming - always ready with a dining suggestion, translation and a kind laugh. My gorgeous room was more of a small apartment and filled with all the things necessary for a relaxing stay, without the added nonsense of neighboring inclusive resorts. My room faced the street, yet ambient noise wasn't an issue - in a city known for its convivial culture, the hotel and surrounding streets were surprisingly quiet by 11 p.m. A number of reviews mention the lack of an elevator, but the stairs would only be a concern for small children or elderly guests. I was within walking distance to everything one could possibly want to do on a city vacation, though I opted for a $2 bus ride to a locals-only beach. Overall, this hotel is a chic, affordable accommodation; perfect for anyone with artistic inclinations and truly a hidden neighborhood gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but has some issues”
Reviews.Author: amandagreen09
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is nestled right in the heart of Old San Juan. It's within walking distance to everything there is to do in the old city, including some great restaurants. We didn't mind the hotel not having an elevator. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the stairs are really no big deal. The room was nice and the lobby is nicely decorated. Our issue was one that we'd read about on the reviews before we booked the room and I guess we should've taken it more seriously. We had an issue with hot water in our room. They did come and fix it, eventually, but it remained an issue throughout our stay. The water was either too hot, or too cold, or it didn't stay hot. I guess it's an old building thing, not really something the staff can control, but just be aware of it before you decide to stay here. By the way, the noise complaints that some people have had was not an issue for us and our room was facing the street. I've definately stayed in noiser rooms in other cities. The reason why I'm rating this place as "average" is because there were some problems with our room, the staff wasn't especially warm or welcoming and overall this hotel just wasn't memorable. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: canuckmedgirl
Reviews.Content: The location in Old San Juan is fantastic for sight seeing, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. We stayed for only one night before embarking on a cruise. The hotel is nicely decorated. The room was a bit small and had no window but was otherwise o.k. The air conditioner made a horrible noise though and the bed was really uncomfortable. The included continental breakfast was fine (toast and cereal). There was the option to order from a breakfast menu and pay for it I believe. My biggest problem was that there was no elevator and we were on the 4th floor and responsible for lugging our own suitcases up that far. The staff weren't exactly friendly but did their jobs. We were able to leave our bags for a few hours after check out to go do more exploring. Overall - good location, clean and nicely decorated but a few issues that would likely stop me from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the heart of O.S.J.!”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: This place is stylishly decorated and ideal for a stay in Old San Juan! The rooms are modest in size, but comfortable and well appointed. The location could not be more ideal, and the staff is really helpful. They were great with information about the town and even let us keep our bags in-between excursions to smaller islands in P.R. Highly recommended if you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “1st anniversary - very special”
Reviews.Author: saharadwller
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for the perfect hotel for our special occasion. I usually look on Trip Adivsor first, and sometimes I go directly to a cities visitor website. At first I booked a room at the Howard Johnson hotel, and we did see that hotel when we were there, but did not go inside. But I changed my mind, because the CasaBlanca was less $ and just had a great history. It was built for Ponce de Leon, though he never got the chance to live there. That in and of itself was enough to pique my interest. I chose a suite, and it was huge! Had we only had the bedroom side, I'm afraid it would have been a little cramped, not terribly, but there would not have been much room to do anything but the usual things you do in a hotel room (sleep). We were going to cruise the following day and had to rearrange our bags since I was smuggling a lot of alcohol that I could pack in my checked luggage for the airlines, but needed to transfer so the cruise ship would not scrutinize the contents of the "checked" bags. The point is we had lots of room to spread out, there was a huge antique wood table and a couch and chairs in the second room. Then we also had a balcony, that was really nice. Originally I wanted to have our anniversary dinner at Marmalade, and discovered it is directly across the street. When we arrived it was hot, October 22, 2011. Hot and humid. We took a taxi from the airport. We enjoyed the drive, it was not far, and you could tell when you were going into Old San Juan. The streets are very narrow, so it is a constant challenge for the drivers. We hopped out of the taxi, no place to park, and drug our luggage into the lobby. There were 5 or 6 parties waiting to check in, the lobby is a little small, but had lots of chairs and couches to sit on. The artwork in the lobby was plentiful and eclectic. I did not mind waiting at all. Once it was our turn, the check in was quick, and one of the guys took my husband's maxed out suitcase and threw it over his shoulder, then picked up my larger piece and hauled it up two flights of stairs while we followed behind. I could not believe it. We handled our luggage on our own on the way out, it was not hard going down, it might have taken a few trips had he not helped us. That is worth mentioning, since it is one of the only drawbacks. Once we checked out the room, which was nice and cool, we explored the rest of the hotel. We also explored the roof. We were tickled by so many things. There were big tubs on the roof. They looked like the tubs from Cialis commercials, even bigger. No idea what they did with them. There were 6 or 8 of them. The views from the top were cool, you could see the water on both sides of the island, the fort and all of the nearby shops, restaurants and hotels. We took a walk and got hot and sweaty, but it was fun to explore. Then we went back to Casablanca to get ready for our anniversary dinner. The bathroom was okay sized, we took turns, not enough room for two people to be in there. When we went to the lobby to exit, we took some cool photos, and the staff went out of their way to move furniture for a better pics. When we returned from the great evening, I was so tired, we went to the room and I crashed, but Larry watched the Cardinals win the 3 game of the World Series. He said he could hear people on the streets until about 11:00 p.m., but he was not disturbed by it. I woke up once and went out on the balcony in the middle of the night and early in the morning. Earlier there were so many people walking around in and out of the shops and restaurants. Now, nobody. Maybe the street cleaners, but no tourists. We were sad to leave even though we were bound for the cruise. To me, this hotel was quaint, romantic and plain fun. It is more like a European hotel. I know a lot of people give bad reviews. I'd rather stay in a unique place rather than a chain ANY day. I certainly recommend this hotel, but I'd add that upgrading to a suite is really the way to go. Hope you like it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, prime location, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mariellynn
Reviews.Content: Before we booked I googled pretty much every review site out there an it was all 3.5 stars. I was skepticle as everyone is because you don't truly know until you're there and experience it yourself. But it's breathtaking. The minute you enter old San Juan you are surrounded by beauty and culture. This hotel is no different. Stunning decor, knowledgable and friendly staff, small rooms but what do you expect you're in the middle of an old town and in the center of everything! Basically it's all how you want to make it- bd I've been in much smaller. Very clean.. Best bars are 5 steps away. Take advantage of an extraordinary opportunity. I will be coming back! Thanks guys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Odd design choices and poor room appointments”
Reviews.Author: davetron5000
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and helpful and the location cannot be beat. However, the rooms were not very comfortable. The AC was quite fussy; woke up at 3am sweating, despite the AC being "on". There is no closet to hang clothes, and most of the lights in the room either didn't work at all, or needed bulb replcaments (staff was very fast in replacing bulbs, but without working overhead lights or windows, it just wasn't a very nice place to be. Bed was pretty uncomfortable and noisy; sheets were very low quality. Shower knob was not well attached; fell off at the slightest touch, and there was no paper holder in the bathroom. I know these sound like nitpicks, but there were a lot of them, so I can't really recommend staying here. It WAS clean, and the location is great. Maybe for one night, on the cheap, it would be OK, but I wouldn't use this is as my base of operations in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable night's stay.”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for luxury and amenities, this place is not for you. But if you want a simple and comfortable hotel, I recommend CasaBlanca! We did our research ahead of time, and were prepared for the lack of elevator, gym, windows, etc. The breakfast is small, yes, but definitely enough. They gave us an iron as soon as we asked, and the staff were always able to help out no matter what! The location is also fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Fun location but loud at night.”
Reviews.Author: dsmithapsu96
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the eclectic environment of the hotel and personal attention offered by the staff. We didn't mind the small room (we stayed in 3A) and we really enjoyed our balcony over the street. Easy walking distance to any location in Old San Juan. Visitors should be aware, however, there is a nightclub nearby that really gets going around 11 pm and doesn't let up until 2:30 or 3:00 am. If you're part of the nightlife, this is no problem. If you need to sleep during these hours, take note and consider this when you book.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Day”
Reviews.Author: Traci09
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before our cruise and it was a perfect choice. The interior of the hotel is amazing. I made the reservation months in advance and was well aware of the issues noted on trip advisor (no elevator, noise, etc.). Our room 2A was lovely with the exception of a bit of mold in one corner of the ceiling. One of the clerks hauled our luggage up the stairs :) The first thing I did was open the doors to the balcony and take in a view of the street below. Then off we went, out the front door and straight into the heart of Old San Juan. First stop, Parque de Palomas (pigeon park), get a $1 bag of feed and be ready :) we wandered around a couple of hours, then found a lovely sidewalk cafe, Cafe de Puerto Rico, where we enjoyed appetizers and Medella beer. Then back to Casablanca, where I had my first ever mojitos (buy 1 get 1 free) YUM! The only low point for me was when i went to the roof to see the tubs and the view. The view of the night across the city was beautiful... the rooftop, however, was under construction :( So... off I went to have another cocktail. Our bartender was fun and friendly and we really enjoyed talking with him and his girlfriend. Eventually we toddled off to our nice comfy bed. The only noise we heard from the street was a garbage truck at 830 sunday morning and I needed to get up and take some advil anyway :/

Reviews.Title: “Could not get a response from the Hotel via email.”
Reviews.Author: TravelNow1956
Reviews.Content: I could not book the room via their on-line system as it was not working. Hence, I sent them an email with four reminders and did not receive any responses from their reservation desk. I ended up booking a room at another hotel. I was disappointed in their lack of responsiveness (customer service).

Reviews.Title: “No pillows, no hot water, roof under construction”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to it's location and the seemingly awesome rooftop terrace with soaking tubs. We stayed in room 5F, which had a nice wooden shuttered window that overlooked the side/back of the building. It was quiet. The couple we traveled with had 4G, which was directly below us and had it's own terrace. The lobby is nicely decorated in Moroccan themed accessories, with comfortable places to hang out and drink mojitos. We thought their bar was a bit expensive, but during happy hour they have 2 for 1, so two drinks are about 10 dollars. The hotel is near one of the only salsa clubs left in town, and is easy walking distance to the pier, San Cristobel, El Morro, and other areas of interest. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly, suggesting places to eat, callilng taxis, and keeping our luggage safe until we left on our cruise. Now, the downside. Our bed had only two decorative pillows. They were tiny throw pillows decorated with sequins. We ended up using the pillows from the small couch instead to sleep with. Our bed had no comforter, just a small blanket. Normally this would be ok in a tropical climate, but they had pre-cooled the room (16 degrees celcius!) and it was freezing. In addition, after a poor night's sleep, our room had no hot water. We tried everything, and ended up taking a cold shower. Our friends had a similar issue, and apparently there is a "magic" position somewhere in the middle of the knob that produces warm/hot water. We did try and call the front desk multiple times to attempt to address these issues, but they did not answer both the room phone or cell phone calls. Our traveling companions, in room 4G, had full sunlight streaming in their faces at 5:30am due to no curtains on the patio door facing their bed. They had bed pillows and a comforter, however. Finally, the rooftop terrace is under construction, with floating 2 x 4s that have nails sticking out. The soaking tubs appear to be disconnected from the draining system, as adding water creates a lake under the tubs. In addition, there were no plugs, so water will not stay in the tubs. We considered the rooftop terrace a total bust. Overall, this was an ok place to stay for one night before our cruise left port. Sure, I would have liked a real bed pillow and hot water, but we piad $90/night, so I feel as if I can't be that picky. I wouldn't pay much more than that however; this is not a high-end boutique hotel, as they attempt to bill themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere....... No elevators!”
Reviews.Author: PerfectBreezeTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise. We enjoyed the hotel thoroughly. The ambiance is great and the staff are friendly and patient. This hotel is right in the middle of Old San Juan which makes it very convenient for everything. Remember there are no elevators!!!!!! That's the only negative thing about the hotel but don't let that change your mind about staying here. This place is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “wish i found it sooner- great spot, unique, artsy, heavenly”
Reviews.Author: journalista307
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. Can't beat the location, and decent price compared to most of the other hotels around.The decorations are amazing, from the lobby to the room. The bed was clean and beautiful with lots of pillows. I found it interesting that the shower had it's own separate "room" made it more luxurious. Only negative thing would be the absence of a toilet paper holder and elevator, but again, the room will make you feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Rachaeldahl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Casablanca for 3 nights and loved it. The hotel lobby's decor is amazing and so unique. It is also in a great location. It is close to all the restaurants and bars and also close to the taxi stand if you prefer leaving Old San Juan. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and if you prefer a bigger room, they have suites. Showers are a good size.The staff is very friendly and so willing to help you plan any excursions. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a visit to San Juan and I found the hotel to be charming. There is no elevator which sucked because we were on the 4th floor. Other than that, I have no complaints. There was a small mix up with my payment. I paid in advance and the sales person didn't have any records of it when I arrived. Although there was a slight mix up, the hotel staff was so accomodating and willing to work with me to get things straightened out. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The location is the best part - right in the middle of Old San Juan. It was just a couple of blocks away from the Plaza Colon and a fabulous restaurant, The Parrot Bay. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Eriadna B
Reviews.Content: I was a guest for just one night and the hotel is excellently located, but try not to bring a car. Old San Juan is old and streets are narrow. But, the public buses are close and from them you can switch to the metropolitan train. The room is cool, quiet, well kept with one caveat: no place to hang your clothes. But for a short stay is GREAT! The continental breakfast is good and all the staff is friendly and helpful, I highly recommend this jewel of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: hfeinberg87
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very unique. Great location, and the chef Juan Carlos is just fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maddux3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after getting married at El Convento. It was perfect! Our room was on the 5th floor which was quite a hike since there is no elevator, but we didn't mind. There was no tv or coffee maker or fancy bathroom set up. It was just a room with a bed, an air conditioner, and a bathroom. Very clean. We never really saw the bar area open, but there was so much to do we didn't really care. The movie Casablanca was playing on the wall 24/7. Late one night we sat in the lounge area and watched it. The roof top area was amazing. The location couldn't be better; it is right in downtown Old San Juan right next to the square, touristy shops, and great restaurants. For less than $100/night, we felt like we found a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Waited Almost a month to charge my credit card”
Reviews.Author: lula1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofo Casablanca during the 3rd week of July and ate at Ricks Cafe. Just yesterday, August 17th, I notice a charge on my account for, low and behold, Rick's Cafe. Concerned that someone may have stolen my bank information I contact my financial institution to inquire why I had a charge for a cafe in San Juan when it was almost a month since I had returned. The service representative informed me that the restaurant just posted it to the account. Why would a merchant wait almost a month to post a charge to my credit card. Seems odd to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quaint Hotel that is Worth a Stay!”
Reviews.Author: etoiles78
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at Hotel Casablanca the Saturday before our cruise on Sunday! It is a nice quaint hotel with charm and in a fantastic location. When we arrived we got there before check in time but they were still ready for us. We were in room 3A so it was not too bad to get upstairs with our luggage. Once we got in the room we started the AC and that worked perfectly the entire time and kept us cool! The bathroom looked updated with newer fixtures and the linens and decor was very unique and made us feel like we were on vacation. We also enjoyed having a balcony to view the city and the location was great - we were able to easily walk to Fort San Cristobal from the hotel. At night the building across the street had a large generator that was making a lot of noise, but there is nothing the hotel can do about that. The generator did help to drown out any people that were screaming/yelling in the street though (these were few and far apart, not continuous). In the morning the hotel comes with a continental breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. You can get coffee, juice, toast/bread, and cereal. The staff is very helpful and gave us directions to places several times. In addition, we wanted to explore more after checking out and before boarding the ship and our luggage was locked up in a room for free after checking out! This was very convenient and we could go back and get it whenever we wanted. Overall we had a very nice stay and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: chicago579
Reviews.Content: We could of stayed @ other hotels...but we wanted to stay in a classic San Juan hotel. Beware of the stairs, no elev! Great decor, great bar...buy one get one free! We enjoyed our stay, besides we were only in the room to sleep...u on vacation so get out and have fun! Plus u can walk every where and back in no time from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place/Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: TrotamundosBetis
Reviews.Content: In a general sense, this hotel is overpriced but, relative to other overpriced Old San Juan choices, it offers good value. Our room was fairly basic with no window. Breakfast was also quite basic (toast) but did include a fresh-squeezed glass of OJ. Overall, I'd say that if you are going to San Juan for a hotel experience, you will be dissapointed...if you are looking for an above-average (non-chain) place to sleep while exploring fantastic Old San Juan, then this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: johnbull2129
Reviews.Content: OK - there are only a few Hotels to choose from in Old San Juan, but staying at the Hotel Casablanca reminded me how much fun Old San Juan is. We went out to Isla Verde and Condado, however we were really happy to get back to the Casablanca. And Fortaleza Street is restaurant row in San Juan and there are some excellent places to enjoy right on the doorstep - but don't worry, the Hotel is an oasis of calm. We loved the Casablanca - from the wonderful staff who truly get to know you, to the eclectic decor and the charming accommodations. Don't let other reviews put you off - if you want a boring shoe-box of a room in a bland business hotel, please go and stay in one. Casablanca is in an old building and has its quirks, but it also offers an authentic experience for incredibly good value for money. Our room was on the third floor and not having an elevator was fine - the exercise did me good after all the food I ate and really this just added to the feeling that you are in an aprtment building. As to some of the other negatives reported in other reviews, we did not have an experience that was anything other than positive from room amenities to service. Did I mention service - everyone (that's everyone) without exception were charming and could have not been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan and Culture”
Reviews.Author: westbender
Reviews.Content: This place was different from any other place i have stayed. I have never been to San Juan and wanted to stay in the heart of the action and this is the place to be. The price was great only $100 and that gets you a small room in a great location. We were also taking the cruise from the port and it was very close we went for the taxi for $15 but you could have walked if you wanted to.. I would stay here again and do recommend it to other who are just there for a night or 2. You get a small breakfast in the morning and it was a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: funtripbf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June with my boyfriend and we were not impressed. It smells musty, they don't provide you with the basic necessities you would expect (had to call 3 times for toilet paper) and there are not blow dryers in the room. If you want to be in Old San Juan I guess the location is good?

Reviews.Title: “Twice stayed and twice charmed ...”
Reviews.Author: J-J-9917
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Old San Juan lies this interesting themed boutique hotel, with a good price and its fairly clean. I liked the fact that they kept the old terrazzo floors, rather than cover them with carpet, as carpet can become dirty quickly, is not easily cleaned and can harbour bugs. I am allergic to bedbug bites and I am very happy to report that I have stayed here twice for 3 and 4 nights, and was not bitten! Not even once! A tip for the traveller, its a lot easier for a hotel to control bugs when the floors are hard surface, so obviously I really like hard surface floors. The first time I stayed on the 4th floor with a little private terrace at the back; it was ok but the outdoor chair was falling apart. The second time I decided to stay on the second floor in one of the two front rooms "close to the party" ... and indeed there was a loud and boisterous party on Saturday night right across the street in a bar / restaurant. And I loved it! Noise and all! I certainly don't go on vacation to sleep on Saturday night! Hello! This hotel may be in the heart of Old San Juan, but the party was definitely the heartbeat! The other three nights it was very quiet. There is a shared roof top terrace on the top of the hotel, but it was a disappointment. I wonder if the hotel owner lives in the vicinity, because the roof top terrace was a wreck to say the least. They should fix it up as it would attract more repeat clients, but don't let this keep you away. As of April 2011 I would recommend this hotel, hopefully they will continue to keep the bugs at bay so that I can stay here again prior to a cruise .....

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, but over promises and under delivers”
Reviews.Author: ktgsmokey
Reviews.Content: Could be a great boutique property, but on every metric it over-promised and under-delivered: waited 35 minutes for oatmeal and eggs which still never came, was promised a special package of spa botanicals (out of stock), gym pass (closed), wifi (broken), cable TV consisted of only the free infomercial channels with no CNN or network service), roof deck (closed), dinner vouchers (not here yet - but finally got them after 4 requests). Terrible, terrible service but an interesting property. Will never stay here again. Much better off for just a few dollars more staying at the El Convento historic hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE IF YOU CAN”
Reviews.Author: David4572
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and could not wait to leave. The location is good for walking around Old San Juan but it is very expensive for cab rides to the beach or other tourist sites because they are far from Old San Juan. The hotel is clean and the staff is nice. The lobby is very cool. At this point all the good has been said. There is no elevator which we knew before we booked but being on the third floor the stairs got old real quick. The rooms are very small with bare cold terazzo floors. The beds are comfortable but the comforters are very thin. There was no closet in the room only two dressers which smelled very musty. The bathroom was very very small. The shower had no soap dish or any ledge to place soap or shampoo bottles. The water in the shower was either very hot or very cold with nothing in between. There were many annoyances wth our room. Our bed sheets were changed only once in 5 nights, several nights our dirty towels were taken but no new towels were left and we had to call. Our last night we had clean towels but no clean wash cloths. During the first three days of our stay our TV did not have any receiption. We complained several times and were told the hotel was waiting for a techniction. Finally we received TV but with not access to any local channels. One night our air conditioner failed and the room was very hot until morning. When the air did work it made the room so damp that everything in the room felt wet including our sheets and clothing. The batteries in both set of remotes for the TV were dead. The worst thing of all was the noise at night. One night there was a loud party in one of the rooms on our floor until 3:00am and nothing was done about it. During both Friday and Saturday nights there is a nightclub directly across the street from the hotel which plays very loud music onto the street until 4:00 am. During those nights it is impossible to sleep with the loud music. We also had no shampoo provided to us during our entire stay. Everyday we asked for shampoo and everyday we were told they wore out. Our stay was to include a contnental breakfast. The breakfast only constisted of ceral, toast, or a small danish. I chose the danish and it was literally one inch by one inch and the coffee was watery. We ate else where. The one morning did need to eat at the hotel because we had an early excursion the restaurant was closed and we were told the cook had not arrived and the hotel did not know when he would be! We travel alot and this hotel was the worst we have seen in a long time. I would not recommend it to anyone for more than one night and never on a weekend. The Sheraton Old San Juan was just around the corner and was a much better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Accomodations okay.”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen813
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was a bit tricky but the receptionist was very detailed in her directions and helped us get there and find good parking. The hotel was beautifully decorated, but the bed was stiff and smelled musty to the point of making my pajamas smell like they'd been in the attic for years. Shower worked fine in terms of pressure but neither my husband or I could find a comfortable temperature. I found that one small adjustment made the water go from cold to scalding hot or vice-versa. The next morning at breakfast we had a very friendly waiter who greeted us but didn't inform us about the complimentary breakfast. They had beverages and fruit off to the side, but we discovered this after we already ordered from the menu and we didn't want to be rude. That being said, our food was good and reasonably-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Wonderful Staff. Clean.”
Reviews.Author: lovemytanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before we left the next day on a 7 day cruise. The lobby is lovely, staff is very accomodating. Clean but small rooms, very comfortable thought. Loud street partying at night, which I had read about before arriving. Bring earplugs for sleeping and you should have no problem. We left our bags at the hotel before we had to head back to the airport and tipped the front desk person for the convenience. He even called us a cab when we were ready to head back to the airport. I would stay again. Lovely and convenient. It was only a 10 minute walk to the cruise port which makes it the perfect place to stay and explore downtown before cruising.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: ZSKniskern
Reviews.Content: We had some problems with our first room (the toilet didn't flush) so they upgraded us to a more spacious room with a king size bed and a huge bathroom. I loved it! The decorations in the hotel are really neat, rooms are a little tight, and there aren't many windows. The restaurant in the building has delicious freshly squeezed orange juice and yummy food. Even though there is a bar downstairs I never heard the music or people. Not many people know that there are 5 tubs on the roof that over look all of old San Juan. My Husband and I enjoyed soaking in them and watching the stars. I have to say that was the best part of staying at this hotel! The water in the bedrooms seems to jump from hot to cold a lot during showers, kind of annoying. Oh and we only paid 129 for a queen bedroom, so I'm not sure why it shows the wrong pricing. The staff we met were all very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: scranton38
Reviews.Content: Like others, we knew there were no elevators, but I didn't know there weren't any windows. I've never stayed in a hotel like this, but I don't mean that in a bad way. It was cute and cozy and a great place to stay for a night before our cruise. They had our room reservation messed up even after confirming over the phone twice, however, it was corrected immediately and worked out even better! It is quite easy to hear most of what goes on in the hotel, but it certainly didn't keep us awake. The bathroom is a little small and the hot water came and went. We did have breakfast downstairs and it was really good. The orange juice was awesome! The location is perfect to explore old San Juan (although maybe do it during the day). Overall, we're likely to stay here the next time our cruise leaves from Puerto Rico since it's just for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEvie
Reviews.Content: My 3 female roommates and I came to San Juan for two nights before exploring the rest of Puerto Rico and loved this hotel. We had room 3b which had a great balcony that overlooked Calle Forteleza. The furniture was beautiful, and the staff was super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Deception”
Reviews.Author: TexasMonthly
Reviews.Content: Writing the review as I'm in the hotel. First, it a small boutique hotel with a great location but it lacks in the boutique service! Do not stay here if you have a choice. The rooms are smaller than advertised, walls are paper thin, we already called twice about music in lobby bar being too loud at 1 am and we are on the 4th floor of hotel! This place is good for one night in a good location but that's about it. The breakfast that is offered is a joke - cereal and milk is what you get! I travel for business & pleasure very frequently and I have lost faith in small boutique hotels after this stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, awful room”
Reviews.Author: seabass13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before departing on our cruise. If it wasn't for the wonderful staff, I wouldn't have anything good to say about this property. They were courteous and helpful on check-in and when we checked out, were pleased to hold our bags while we toured old San Juan before boarding our ship cruis ship in the evening. As for the room, it was small, dark and had no window. The bathroom was extremely small with very bad lighting, no toilet paper holder (it was sitting on the back of the toilet), no place in the shower to put soap/shampoo, no drinking glasses. Forget about watching TV, it did not work. The promised 'continental breakfast' was supposed to be available until 11:00 but when we showed up at 10:30, were told that we were too late but could order something from the menu, for a cost. The continental breakfast, as it turns out, is actuaklly 1 coffee and 1 pastry.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love it, but this hotel didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: zazie_dans_metro
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel. In fact, though my partner and I went to Puerto Rico mainly to lounge on the beach in Vieques, we decided to spend two nights in San Juan just because we were so excited about this hotel. The hotel is centrally located in Old San Juan. As soon as we walked in the vibe was great: super bright, funky lobby, and the whole place smells absolutely beautiful. The room they took us to was really very beautiful and well decorated, but it had no balcony-- a disappointment after we had paid more for a room with a balcony. Then I went downstairs to complain, and we had to wait to get shuffled to another room. This room had a balcony and even a nicely appointed sitting room, though with no view, and it meant we got downgraded to a double bed, rather than a queen, which is what we had ordered and would have preferred. That said, we loved the aesthetic and the vibe. We had brought a bottle of wine and particularly enjoyed lounging in the living room drinking it. There were numerous other little things that were off. The TV didn't work; our room was without hot water for the entire time we were there. We paid $130 a night for the room, which, considering all the numerous problems, was ridiculous. I was particularly teed off that we didn't even get hot water for the price, and the staff seemed put upon that we wanted a discount. In the end, they said they would simply comp our breakfast--even though according to the terms of the booking, it should have been free. By that point we were about to leave, and out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at a boutique hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jmp2151
Reviews.Content: My husband and I greatly enjoyed our stay here. We wanted to be in Old San Juan rather than in one of the big, soulless resorts on the beach, and were happy with our decision. We liked the stylish faux-Moroccan look- it was attractive without being too much. Our room wasn't large but was comfortable, and we weren't planning on spending much time indoors anyway. My only complaint might be that our only window looked out onto the internal courtyard, which--although quite lovely--obviously didn't afford any fresh air. There is a roof deck which is just a little shabby but fun for a great view nonetheless. The proprietress made check in easy and was a great resource for recommendations- both in San Juan, and farther afield. And for the price, this place could not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: mdroom101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel 1 night before our cruise. we were looking for a hotel in a good location that was "authentic" not commercialized. We were very pleased. The staff was wonderful. Checkin was a breeze, they kept our luggage the entire next day so we could tour the town. We called for more towels and bottled water and it arrived to our room within minutes. We were traveling with another couple so we chose the suite room 3B. It was 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom & 1 balcony. One of the bedrooms had a double size bed, the other had a queen. One room had the street side with a balcony and the other had an interior room. It was really loud with street noise.... but we didn't mind! The interior room was much less noisey. This hotel was exactly what we expected and exactly what we were looking for! We loved it and thought it really added to our entire Puerto Rico experience. After our cruise (a week later) we showed up at the hotel (unannounced) with our luggage and asked them to store it so we could walk around town while we waited for our flight. They happily stored our luggage for no charge because we were guests there the week prior! If you are traveling with a family of small children or elderly I would suggest against this hotel. No elevator... but that wasn't an issue at all for us. Tip - Take a trip up to the roof to check out the view and the hot tubs.... it was a little unorganized up there, but really neat and worth the 6 flights of stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite ready for business yet.....”
Reviews.Author: Jackwillow
Reviews.Content: We walked in the door and were very impressed! A beautiful space awaits! And the people were all very kind. We didn't even mind walking up the stairs to the 4th floor. Our room, too, was small but very beautifully decorated and the bed was great. However, the room temperature was very cold and the thermostat was practically on the ceiling, so we had to stand on the bed to just reach it. Becasue the floors were stone, they held the cold and when the room warmed a bit, the floors then became wet with condensation. Neither the phone or the television worked - although they were new.
