The room needs hooks of some sort to hang things on - no place for damp towels... no glass in the bathroom for water. Around 8:30 pm a very loud band began to play at the bottom of the atrium. Our bathroom window was on the atrium. We were having to wake up at 4 am for our flight, so in order to drown out the sound, we turned on the fan/light in the bathroom to make some white noise - We put our covers over our heads to block out the light from the bathroom and did our best to sleep. This hotel has great potential - but we hope that they address some of these things before long. We also saw no sign of an emergency exit from our floor.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: asiri_trip
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel 3 stars- but I am being generous. First of all I am a sucker for decor. The decor in the lobby is great- a lot of eye candy. The rooms are modern and has Moroccan flair. The rooms were fairly clean but could of been cleaner. Yes there are stairs- NO ELEVATOR so be prepared to walk( We even ran into a couple who called in and asked if the hotel if they had an elevator, and they said YES! LIARS!: so do not believe what they say: NO ELEVATORS) I would of given this place more stars and not have such a bitter taste in my mouth if I had HOT WATER. After a long day of trekking, and finally arriving at our hotel, all my boyfriend wanted was a hot shower. It didnt work- so I called the front desk. They said they would reset the water heaters. So I waited and waited... then I tried it again--NO HOT WATER. The next day same thing: NO HOT WATER... so I went to the front desk and told them the situation. She sat there and asked if I turned the knob correctly- I said yes.... she didnt offer an refund or coupon to a free breakfast at Rick's Cafe etc... she just sat on her FAT [--] and made it seem like it was our fault.... GEEZ! Well, as you can see it still leaves a bitter taste in my mouth- I mean why the attitude? This hotel is no EL Convento. Location of the hotel is perfect though- we had no noise issue (maybe we're heavy sleepers?) We were in room 4A and our balcony opened up to Fortaleza St. Also I was super excited about the tub on the roof- but unfortunately I didn't use it.... But I did go up there and there was a great view. The tubs are kinda cool but it is junky up there. Someone really needs to clean the rooftop up because there is CRAP everywhere- pieces of random lumber, scraps etc... it need improvement. So I wasn't in love with this hotel but it is Cheap if you want to spend 1 or 2 nights in a hotel vs. a hostel and you can't afford El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: aikman04
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming hotel. The atmosphere of the hotel and the room's is very much in line with the style of Old San Juan. It has a good location if you want to stroll around San Juan. There was an insect in our room but it was quickly removed by the staff. The staff is very friendly, they were glad to help us find our way around San Juan. During our stay there was a wedding in the hotel, there was some noise but it was ok, from inside our room we could barely hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Rick's Cafe -- terrible service”
Reviews.Author: PaulofDC
Reviews.Content: This review is actually of Rick;s Cafe, the eatery within the hotel,not of the hotel itself. We can with a breakfast voucher from the nearby Da House (common ownership?). The voucher is for a coffee and a pastry, and they mean what they say -- if you want tea, you pay extra. Sadly, this morning they couldn;t find their tea bags. All they could offer was hot water. But the waiter didn't tell me that for some time. First there was a crisis getting clean mugs. Then he took 20 minutes to tell me he was looking for the tea bags. The, after some nice chit chat with the front desk and other meanderings, finally I learn that the tea bags cannot be located sorry. I asked for a cappucino; he went to the kitchen and came back with word that cappucino was "not possible".

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: asl202
Reviews.Content: We came here for the first few days of our honeymoon. It is within walking distance of everything in Viejo San Juan, and some of the rooms have delightful balconies over the street. The street could be a little noisy, but my husband required ear plugs only one of the nights we were there and I slept wonderfully. The key to our room did not work for the duration of our stay, but they provided free breakfast in Rick's Cafe to make up for this. You definitely need to check out the tubs on the roof for the view and wonderful relaxation. We were the only people using them each time, despite a full hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hereandtheretraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is several in one, depending upon which room or suite you end up in. Overall, BE CAREFUL - some of the rooms are simply AWFUL - noisy, inadequate space, missing towel fixtures, NO LIGHT and unrelenting noise! Other rooms are spacious and private. But, all rooms are nothing but hard surfaces that reflect noise and very little light. The good of the hotel is its location, and, generally, accommodating management depending upon who is on duty. We had called in advance to inquire about parking, and I was told on the phone that there were two nearby parking garages, one expensive, one reasonably priced. When I got to the hotel, the manager on duty sent us to the expensive garage, and, I didn't discover this until leaving 1 1/2 days later and being hit with an $80 parking charge. In general, I would not recommend this hotel - just too many negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you don't want another American hotel!”
Reviews.Author: courtewilliams
Reviews.Content: While we were staying in San Juan the SoFo Festival was going on, so we were able to take advantage of vendors, artisans, music and nightlife right outside the front door! The staff upon our arrival was able to accomodate a late check-out so that we could enjoy the next day in the city before catching our cruise ship. While the hotel does not have elevators, there are employees on hand to carry luggage up to your room. Our room was small and quaint. The young man working the front desk took the time to show us how to use the key card and thermostat remote. The CasaBlanca is not a hotel you should be staying in if you are looking for cable tv, and peace and quiet, but it's great for the location and the excellent customer service we received! Our breakfast that was included only included a danish and coffee, however a larger menu is available for purchase. The following morning the woman working the front desk took the time to call various cruise lines for all guests checking out to confirm ports for boarding, and give special directions for individuals staying in the city that wanted to walk around. We were very pleased with the service and accomodations we recieved on our one night in San Juan, we would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location but check your linens.”
Reviews.Author: tavel512
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, pleasant staff, no elevator. We had three couples, three rooms and everyone was missing something, two rooms with no pillowcases, the other room got pillowcases but only one towel. Too much trouble to walk down 4 very tall flights so we all went without. Breakfast is included but only the minimal, coffee, juice, a bowl of cereal or a small pastry or toast. There were other oddities, a nice toilet, very modern, but no toilet paper holder. Seems to be a work in progress from cool tile to unfinished concrete floor.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went wrong”
Reviews.Author: diamondman
Reviews.Content: The tv didn't work. There was no light in the bathroom. there was no remote for the nine foot high air con control. The towels were small and scratchy. Management was very pleasant but did not help. Noise from lobby and street was intolerable til 2am. Good location

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MarkinMontreal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 1 night before our cruise. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The free mojito was a welcome treat after a long day of travel. The location is very good as well. As others have mentioned it is walking distance to many attractions. We had an inside room, it wasn't the end of the world, there were 2 windows but they opened into inside areas so we left them closed. There was free wifi in the lobby. The only complaints we had was that it was noisy. There is a bar on the main floor beside the lobby and the noise, even 3 floors up, was very evident until about 1am when the patrons started leaving. We put our ear plugs in and it was ok. Also, the air conditioner controls are near the ceiling. You had to be 9 feet tall to reach the controls or move some furniture to reach them.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel but not a good choice for me. Stay at the El Convento Hotel if you want comfort and a quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ksunset
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a standard room facing the street. The noise from the street from people partying and loud music kept me up until 3:30 am. The room was so cold and I didn't even have the AC running. The bed was hard and in the morning I had to talk a cold shower as there was no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “You shouldn't stay here...or at least be warned first!”
Reviews.Author: Dukealumvandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night before leaving on a cruise out of San Juan. The price was pretty good, and the location of the hotel is great. That, however, is where the pluses end. Although the lobby is gorgeous, once you get upstairs the hotel room leaves much to be desired. AND know that the hotel has NO elevators--so be prepared to carry your luggage up several flights of hard, STONE steps. My husband and I are not the pickiest travelers, so it is saying a lot that we found the hotel to be unacceptable. You'll understand why after reading below. The phones at the hotel WERE NOT working. At all. Therefore, when my husband wanting something he literally had to yell down into the lobby or walk up and down all of those steps to speak to hotel staff. The cable and Internet at the hotel WAS NOT working. At all. Therefore there was nothing to watch in our room, and we had to walk to the Sheraton in the heat and PAY to use their Internet to print out cruise documents. The woman at the front desk was also pretty unconcerned about this--she was more interested in the chocolate cake that the chef had just given her. It was basically like, "Oh well". I also saw other hotel guests complaining to the hotel staff about this. And finally, at about 7:00 am on Sunday morning, there was a huge crowd of raucous people in the lobby singing and yelling. That was fun to wake up to. And p.s.: your room actually sits on a hall that opens up to the lobby from ALL floors (kind of like a balcony hall), so we got quite an earful. When my husband complained, he was told by staff that the people had already been spoken to. Thanks for nothing. And the bathroom was pretty dingy and smelled--like a bathroom. If we could barely make it through for a night, I can't imagine how other people would make it for more days than that. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe, excellent location, good price”
Reviews.Author: mjmjmj2010
Reviews.Content: Being a single female traveller, my requirements are a safe location, clean room and a low price. Hotel Casablanca offers this plus excellent location. It is noisy in the evenings as they have a friendly well catered bar on the first floor but earplugs came in quite handy and I slept quite well. Nice young guys at the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: harriscath
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Casa Blanca for 3 nights in August and found it perfectly suitable. Staying in the Old Town was the best option because it has such a charming atmosphere, its close to all the main attractions and there are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. So the location of Casa Blanca is perfect. Plus the staff were very helpful telling us where the best places to head were. We had an interior room and werenâ€™t disturbed by noise at all. We had actually just got off a cruise ship where our cabin had no window at all so the â€˜internalâ€™ window was an upgrade for us! When we were a little claustrophobic, we went up to the rooftop. Although the roof top is not finished, there were some lounges up there and we spent some time watching the sun go down and enjoying the good views in the evening. The rooms were clean, cool and beautifully decorated. The only disappointment was breakfast, which as quite sparse. Of course you could pay and order more expansive options though. In August, it was ridiculously hot outside, so if I were staying longer I would look for a hotel with a pool. I believe there were a few nice looking hotels with rooftop pools in the Old Town next to the wharf. If I had my time again and could afford to spurge, Iâ€™d definitely check out those options. Otherwise I would definitely recommend Casa Blanca.

Reviews.Title: “SOFO CasaBlanca - Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sburnett
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, above and beyond. Great rooms like an eclectic bed and breakfast and a really beautiful hotel. The rooms are small and sweet and tasteful - It is so charming and pretty and very clean. How much time do you actually hang out in the hotel room while on vacation? It was a completely comfortable and safe place to call home after walking all over Old San Juan! We Will Definately stay there again! We stayed 1 night before our cruise and 2 nights after. A fantastic location in the heart of old san Juan. Walk to everything and convenient. Everyone said the no elevator was an issue... why? It is literally a few extra moments out of your day and seriously the hotel is worth every bit of any time spent in old san juan! Its beautiful and We absolutely loved this hotel and the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Old San Juan location and very unique”
Reviews.Author: Akuhlrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Casablanca for one night while in Old San Juan. It was a perfect location to be stationed at in order to walk around the town. The hotel itself was very clean, and awesomely decorated. The service was great too. We came from checkout at a different hotel which was several hours earlier than Hotel Casablanca's check-in time. However, they had no problem letting us check in early since our room was available. The bed was very comfortable and we slept really well. The price was right too!

Reviews.Title: “Well decorated, Excellent location, Good Service, and a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: discgolfbeth
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't beat this place. We stayed in 3H as far away from the front entrance to the hotel and the clubs/street noise wasnt an issue. The hotel itself was loud. The sound just bounces around; there's no carpet and the walkways upstairs are open to the lobby. There was a wedding taking place with music blaring, VERY LOUD. They did stop at midnight, so it wasnt too bad. The room was a bit small. It was perfect for a couple. The decor was amazing, so well done. The service was fantastic. There was an annoying drawback, that you have to wait at the door to be buzzed in - I mean it's safe, but it also took awhile sometimes for the staff to let you in. Oh, and the have a delish breakfast which I wasnt expecting! Overall, if you think you can get past the noise, then stay here. The hotel is beautiful, location is great, and the value is something you cant pass up!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay, a place to lay you head.”
Reviews.Author: cindy2810
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night at the Hotel Casablanca on April 3rd, 2010 along with 6 of his family members. We had a very nice room, it was small but because we only needed it for 1 nights sleep it was perfect! I did get awakened around 1 or 2 in the morning by a couple of girls who were stumbling in from a night of fun but I didn't care, we were on vacation and so were they so have fun!! It was pretty noisy with all the loud music that you could hear from outside but I wasn't worried about it because it was just people having a good time. It was in a very good location, close to shopping and very close to the pier that we needed to be at to get on our cruise ship. The look of the hotel on the inside was very nice. The only thing I had an issue with was that when I went to have a shower the knob to adjust the water came off so we weren't able to shower that morning. It wasn't even that big of a deal because we were about to get on our cruise ship in a few hours and I knew I could shower then. I let the gentleman at the desk know about the problem and he got right on it which I honestly though was great. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who just needs it to get one night of sleep. It looks like they are still doing renovations on it and I think when they are done it will be even better. When we were there they still didn`t have an elevator so you had to carry your luggage up to your floor but they were working on getting the elevator going. I really did enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Morocco in the middle of Old San Juan and unique spot before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: TDBBerlin
Reviews.Content: General: Hotel is NOT 200 % perfect, but unique, neat and a special place to be.Rooms a bit small, mostly queen size beds. Situated on Fortaleza Road, which is right in the center of Old San Juan. Close to everything, easy walking distance to restaurants, harbor, shopping, cafes, bars etc. Parking: forget it, but public car park is close. Complementary breakfast, which is small in size but good in quality. Bring hairdryer and good condition (no elevator). We stayed two nights before a cruise and liked style and location. If your cruise leaves at night, you are welcome to leave your luggage in the hotel during the day. Improve: We contacted the hotel several times by email out of Germany and never got any response.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel if you are looking to get a good night sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1970
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights at this hotel prior to leaving for a cruise. Check in was not too bad. We did not have to wait too long â€“ it was after 3PM. I was in room 2A and my parents were in 2C. Room 2A was okay in size and had a balcony overlooking the street in front. Room 2C was very small with an interior window that opened to the lobby. Neither room had a closet, so there is really no place to hang clothes. The bed vas very hard and uncomfortable. Beware; this hotel still does not have a working elevator. I was told that it would be installed when I booked the hotel last fall. We were on our own in bringing our suitcases down the stairs upon checkout. The rooftop area does not look complete either. There are lots of boards and nails lying around and the area needed to be cleaned â€“ the bathtubs were filthy! It could be a nice area if it were better taken care of. The hotel is located right in the heart of Old San Juan. It is a nice location to browse the shops during the day; however, we did not feel safe walking around in the evening/night. Finally, Do not stay at this hotel if you are looking to get a good night sleep! Throughout the night we were kept awake by a loud party going on in the lobby and then by people partying in the street. It was so bad that we decided to check out of the hotel the next morning. Fortunately, the hotel agreed to refund us for the 2nd night.

Reviews.Title: “Original hotel in the heart of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: AliciaBrugge
Reviews.Content: If you like luxury, this hotel is not for you, but if you like originality, it will be perfect for you. The decor of the reception area makes guests to take a lot of pictures. The service was perfect. The room was ok, a little run down... Breakfast was a dissapointment... We would probably go back to this hotel but only if he had to stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “Glitz hides the gross”
Reviews.Author: abco21
Reviews.Content: We arrived sweaty and tired at 10am on a Monday. We weren't allowed to check in until 3pm despite the hotel being relatively quiet. We returned to the hotel - after walking in the heat - at 2.45pm. We watched as the woman at the desk told people they could not check in until 3pm, right up until 2.55pm. At 3pm, she BEGAN the paperwork for the line of people waiting to check in. The first room we were in had over 7 flies in it. When I called the front desk to tell them, the woman said "Ok, thanks" but was too busy dealing with the paperwork to do anything. A man finally came in and sprayed aerosol bug spray everywhere making the windowless room reek. Then the shower didn't work; it would go from burning hot to freezing cold without every turning the knob. The man gave us a different room right down the hall (amazing they had empty rooms when we couldn't check in until 3pm) and it was decent but small with no closet and just a few hangers. Breakfast was mouldy apples, butter that had been sitting out uncovered near the flies, and cheap white bread. For a tiny bit extra, go the The Gallery. This is an abysmal miserable place to be.

Reviews.Title: “High on Flair, low on function”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasrich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night. It is in a great location and a easy walk to everything that is wonderful about Old San Juan. We did not drive in Old San Juan. The bathroom shower handle immediately fell off upon our arrival. The VERY basic cable channel selection is abysmal and there is no elevator and because there is no elevator guests drag their suit cases down the staircase in the early A.M. sending a thunderous noise thoughout the property. The employees we encountered were competent and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, perfect location, but some details are lacking”
Reviews.Author: intrepid42
Reviews.Content: The lobby is spectacular and the location ideal. Our room was stylish but lacked some of the small conveniences that make traveling easier: shampoo, wall hooks to hang clothes and towels, a plastic bag for laundry. It seemed they were in the middle of minor renovations, so perhaps these details will be addressed. Two other details: No wi-fi, but a hotel around the corner lets Casablanca guests use theirs. Free breakfast was rather paltry.

Reviews.Title: “Cute decor, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Judybusy
Reviews.Content: I would love to give this hotel a great review, but there were just enough little things gone wrong. Many have been mentioned in other reviews: no closet, no towel racks, poor breakfast service, inconsistent housekeeping, no remote for AC (which was resolved) needed help figuring out the cable, noisy due to the echo chamber created by the atrium. We stayed a total of five nights. My biggest complaint is the noise factor created by the hotel itself--it's the deal-breaker for me. On Friday, the hotel played hard-driving rock till 11:45 p.m. The staff did turn it down and move the speakers when I called at 11:15. All other evenings, no music, so it was quiet. The quietest rooms are probably those those ending in d, e, f, and h. All others face the street or share a wall with the atrium. B is close to the stairs, which are noisy. We were in 3G, and had no issues with street noise, but it shares a wall with the atrium. Breakfast is a disorganized mess. They couldn't keep coffee flowing or breadand pastries stocked, and always ran out of clean cups silverware, etc. Save yourself the irritation and go to Siglo XX on the other side of the street for good coffee and basic breakfast. Treat yourself to breakfast at Hotel El Convento's restaurant at least one morning, too. It's served in a gorgeous open air courtyard and was so delicious! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and mostly made things right when we complained. They helped us with a car rental, too. Our first night, we were upgraded to the suite as our room had a leak issue. That lobby is stunning, and the rooms charmingly decorated. For the price and old building, I thought they were good-sized. With more attention to detail, this could be a truly great little hotel, one of those hidden gems--the location can't be beat. So go ahead and stay, but be prepared for these annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Helena Traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the center of old town this hotel is one of a few choices near good restaurants and clubs. The upgrades in this hotel are mostly cosmetic...and as other reviews state the hotel is still under construction. The T.V. in our room worked but we never could get the cable to work properly. The bathroom had only 2 bath towels no toiletries and there was no place to put our dop kit. The roof top tubs looked interesting but there was too much wood and construction debris to step over and around to get there. The front desk staff had other business that always seemed more important than their guests. The biggest problem was that while we were in San Juan it was very rainy. Upon returning from a day of sightseeing & a huge amount of rain we got to our room and found that someone had been in and picked up our bags off the floor. The rain water had come in off the roof and down the stairs and seeped under the wall and the door. There were towels in the hall against the wall of our room. In the morning when we woke there was at least an inch of water all over the floor and seeping up the bedspread. All of this took place and no one from the staff even acknowledged that there was a problem. Luckily we were checking out that morning so we tip toed through the water puddles and packed our bags. This hotel is just pretending to be a chic hotel...I think i will try a more established hotel the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel....but needs work. Bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: seanmcca
Reviews.Content: While overall my wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Casa Blanca, we felt it could have been so much better. First, the location is great. It's located on Fortaleza Street, right in the heart of Old San Juan and perfect for sightseeing. And if you like clubs, you're in luck, there's one next door that blasts music till dawn. For those of you who aren't night owls, bring earplugs. The room itself was very nice, if a bit smokey, complete with a balcony overlooking the street, a big comfortable bed, a highend Sylvania TV with Blueray player and a clean bathroom with a great shower. However, the TV didn't work, none of the cables were hooked up, and we had to wait hours for clean towels. When the towels finally arrived, they were hand towels. The rooftop patrio was great, outstanding views, bathtubs to soak in and comfortable chairs to relax in. The only problem was the unused lumber and construction equipment laying around everywhere. One aspect of the hotel that cannot be criticized is the lobby. Elegantly decorated with a Middle Eastern feel, the lobby has ornate furnishings, a bar and decorative paintings. Definitely a place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Our only dealing with the staff came at check in where a slight mixup over payment was quickly and politely resolved by the young man who helped us. Overall, the Casa Blanca is a tough hotel to review. There are many positives to speak of, but there are also negatives. And while it isn't the hotels fault a club is next door, it is something that needs to be mentioned. As far as the hotel's other deficiencies, I believe most were do to an inexperienced staff and the hotel's relative youth.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTheRoad7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casablanca for 3 nights in two different rooms. First 2 nights, paid $50 additional for room with patio. Not worth the extra $ (see photo). Rooms had comfy beds and nice linens. We stayed in rooms on the back side of the hotel that were very quiet. Cleaning service was inconsistent (forgot to change the sheet one night, but left it with our towels (sometimes we got 1 wash cloth, sometimes days we got none)). Nice TV's, but they only worked sporatically. Marga at the front desk was great! Mike at the bar was great! Hotel is in great location in Old San Juan. You're lucky if you find free street parking. If not, you'll have to pay at a nearby garage, but rates are reasonable. Quick luggage pick-up and drop-offs can be done at the front door. Continental breakfast was included with our rate. Hotel is putting in an elevator - so if your room is on a higher floor, be prepared to carry your luggage up several flights of stairs. Hotel decor was very nice and, overall, we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible service, no amenities.”
Reviews.Author: michigantravelar
Reviews.Content: A charming boutique hotel in old town San Jaun. We got no sleep because of the party going on in the bar--no mention of this when we arrived. The water was cut off in the middle of trying to take a shower. Phone calls to the hotel staff are not returned, forget about email. It's as if the owners and staff are completely unfamiliar with the concept of customer service. The best part of our stay was that thankfully we only booked one night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 503”
Reviews.Author: BigDAWGTacoma_WA
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, king size bed, good A/C - that's the extent of the good things.. No elevator. No pillows in the room at 4:30 check in. 11' x 11' room, no end tables, no headboard, no closet. 3 lights in the room/bathroom, only 1 worked. No hand towels, no washcloths, no kleenex, just 2 large towels. 19" Tv, dish network with only a few operating channels, needed two remotes because the Dish network remote never had the TV programmed in to it. Translucent window to the hallway with no curtains so the lights from the hall lit up the room all night.. Bathroom: 3.5' x 6' of which 1/3 was shower.. Top of the mirror is 4.5' off the ground.. Old tile with numerous patches - probably 30+ years old. Noisy all Saturday night. Breakfast at the hotel - Skip it. Orange juice pitcher and coffee which was not refilled, crowded, toast and cereal. Go to McDonald's/Burger King or anywhere else. I would not have stayed there for a 2nd nite...............

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaLynnE
Reviews.Content: If you like hotels that offer charm and ambiance rather than large-chain, cookie-cutter appointments, you will adore the SOFO CasaBlanca. The lobby is colorful and inviting, the rooms are comfortable and attractively appointed and the staff are friendly and attentive. The location was right in the heart of Old San Juan and it was an easy walk to restaurants and attractions. I hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in San Juan before the prices go up!”
Reviews.Author: DanyaJ
Reviews.Content: I don't think I would have been able to stay in Old San Juan if I had not found this place! It had a fantastic location in the heart of Old San Juan and was a great price. As it is a new hotel, there are several things that need to be worked out yet - elevator (we stayed on the fourth floor and those steps get old after awhile), a few more people to handle the breakfast rush, a larger coffee pot to serve more people, and a towel rack in the bathrooms. But this hotel is so beautiful and has such a great location that I fear the prices will go up like the rest of the places to stay in Old San Juan once the hotel is fully up and running. Stay there now while it is the best bargain in the area. (And eat at Marmalade Restaurant across the street which is very, very good.)

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary1968
Reviews.Content: Our experience was not quite what we had hoped for. We arrived on Thursday. The hotel had no parking so we lugged our things from the parking garage blocks away. We then had to carry our suitcases up 3 flights of stairs to our room...no elevator or bell hop service. The location of the hotel iwas great, right in the thick of things in Old San Juan. Absolutly no complaints there but by 1:30pm on Friday there was no power. Our interior room started heating up and there was no light whatsoever in the bathroom. The desk kept telling us that the power company would be out. By 11pm there was nothing but one tea candle to light our room. I had to struggle just to get a glass of water. A private party was at the bar making plenty of noise late into the night. There were no apologies from the staff nor comp drinks nor buckets of ice. There was no coffee or toast the next day and no breakfast offered any where else. As a matter of fact, we were directed by a staff member to another popluar breakfast spot and, when we got there, it was closed for renovations!! By 3 pm on the following day we still had no tv, hot shower, lights, air or ice. When we checked out we were not given any credit for our inconvenience and carried our own bags down the 3 flights of stairs and over to the parking garage. The room was about 50 dollars less per night than the Marriott or Sheraton but not worth the aggravation to this old dog.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan Boheme”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casablanca January 22-24. Arrived Friday afternoon to full lobby waiting to check in. Hotel is still being finished so there are some issues mentioned in other reviews. That being said, it is still a charming and unique property. Staff does their best to satisfy. After checking in and getting to our room, 4 A, we heard a loud explosion and the electricity went out. A transformer next door had blown. Attempts to repair it caused a second transformer to go. No electricity from Friday afternoon until Saturday around 6pm. The hotel was not responsible for this, just general infrastructure issues. Sounds awful doesn't it? Imagine a Morrocan villa entirely lit by candle light. Even the stair case was filled with candles. Fortunately we had an outside room with a balcony to provide fresh air. I would recommend this to other travelers. The staff provided ice buckets full of ice for everyone, lots of candles, and opened the bar. It turned into a party on a street full of parties! Breakfast is included, and was a little tricky Saturday morning, but those who wished-were sent to another property for a full breakfast. We were happy with the juice and fresh pastries the staff brought in. When the power returned on Saturday night, staff had beer on ice for all and insisted on full refunds for everyone who had stayed the night. We had a great time, but we were out sightseeing on Friday afternoon and evening, as well as all day Saturday. Rooms are small, but this is a colonial building, we have found the same all over Central and South America. Decor is eclectic and arty. Bathroom was small but had a glass sink and Italian decorative mirror. We had satelite TV but didn't use it. WiFi worked fine as did the air when we had power. I chose this property based on TA reviews and the price point. It's perfect for staying in OSJ and not paying an arm and a leg. We chose to spend our dollars on the fabulous food and drink! Calle Fortaleza is a party no doubt about it. We were right over the street with our balconey open the first night. But I had read the reviews and brought ear plugs which made sleeping just fine. You are across the street from Marmalade the trendy new restaurant, and in the same block as the Parrot Club, Aquaviva, Tantra, etc. Location can't be beat. The free trolleys stop right down the block so you can get all the way out to El Morro without walking if you wish. Staff helped us find a rental car for a daytrip to El Yunque, and called taxis for us as needed. Very responsive. Casablanca might not be for everyone, but was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: I did some research on TA and booked this hotel, but ended up being disappointed with it. The first impression is of an attractive, eclectic hotel, but after a few moments you realize the Casablanca is poorly maintained and poorly run, parts of the hotel looked a bit like a work in progress with electric cables hanging from the walls etc. The staff was moderately helpful, our room was very very tiny, it had no window, the tv antenna was on the ground, but no tv in the room. And no phone either, so for everything we had to walk up and down the stairs (no elevator). I don't mind walking but we had to walk up and down a lot because our room keys never worked, so it ended up becoming pretty annoying. The room was so and so clean and breakfast in the morning was basic (juice, coffee, pastries, bread). The good things about the hotel are the location, the free wifi in the hall, and the deck, where you can enjoy a nice view. If the Casablanca were spruced up and managed properly it would be a great hotel but as it is now it's depressing and pretentious. And you don't get enough bang for your buck.

HotelInfo.Name: CasaBlanca Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 316 Fortaleza St. | Old San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
